summary: The text discusses the concept of judgment, where those deemed weak and contemptible by the world, chosen by God, will judge others in the future, referencing Matthew 19:28 where the disciples judge the twelve tribes of Israel. It mentions exorcists among the Hebrew people who drove out demons, including a historical account from Josephus about Solomon's wisdom in exorcising demons. Josephus describes a particular ritual involving a ring with Solomon's seal used to cast out demons, showcasing the enduring power of exorcism methods attributed to Solomon.
